mccarthy.gloss: United States satirical novelist and literary critic (1912-1989)
United States politician who unscrupulously accused many citizens of being Communists (1908-1957)

mccartney.gloss: English rock star and bass guitarist and songwriter who with John Lennon wrote most of the music for the Beatles (born in 1942)

mccauley.gloss: heroine of the American Revolution who carried water to soldiers during the Battle of Monmouth Court House and took over her husband's gun when he was overcome by heat (1754-1832)

mccormick.gloss: United States inventor and manufacturer of a mechanical harvester (1809-1884)
United States operatic tenor (born in Ireland) (1884-1945)

mcgraw.gloss: United States baseball player and manager (1873-1934)

mcguffey.gloss: United States educator who compiled the McGuffey Eclectic Readers (1800-1873)

mcguffin.gloss: (film) a plot element that catches the viewers' attention or drives the plot

mcia.gloss: an agency of the United States Marine Corps that provides responsive and broad intelligence support for the worldwide Marine Corps organization

mckinley.gloss: a mountain in south central Alaska

mcluhan.gloss: Canadian writer noted for his analyses of the mass media (1911-1980)

mcmaster.gloss: United States historian who wrote a nine volume history of the people of the United States (1852-1932)

mcpherson.gloss: United States evangelist (born in Canada) noted for her extravagant religious services (1890-1944)
